Long term requires vision. Stop loss is a piece of nonsense which lets you believe you're long term. You're not. Stop loss orders would have liquidated Bitcoin investments a hundred times in the past 5 years. Yet if you held you would have made 61,000 times your investment.

"You would just end up with multiple factions claiming they are using the real Bitcoin." Yes... this has already happened.

"The total network" is an emergent property that results from the actions of many individuals. There is no entity that is "the Bitcoin network" and that's why trying to describe who protects / controls it is generally a wasted effort.

Full nodes resist any type of attack with invalid data regardless of hashpower. For example, SegWit2X / Bitcoin Unlimited at times supposedly had majority of hashpower. If those miners started creating invalid blocks, they'd be rejected by full nodes that didn't agree.
